Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut

Class HanoiAcc

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AutomatonComponent
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.Acc<R>
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AbstractAcc<GraphicComponent,​GraphicComponentSet,​GraphicComponentList,​GraphicComponentRun,​HanoiAcc>
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.HanoiAcc
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, SetListener<GraphicComponent>, Editable
public class HanoiAcc
extends AbstractAcc<GraphicComponent,​GraphicComponentSet,​GraphicComponentList,​GraphicComponentRun,​HanoiAcc>
implements SetListener<GraphicComponent>
This class provides an implementation of a Hanoi acceptance condition, which contains
  • a Boolean expression over AcceptanceAtom, and
  • a list of acceptance sets, of which each acceptance set has a unique ID.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
"http://adl.github.io/hoaf/", Serialized Form

    • getAcceptanceSets

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​GraphicComponentSet> getAcceptanceSets()
      Returns all the acceptance sets as a map from an ID to the acceptance set of the ID. Adding acceptance sets to or removing acceptance sets from the returned list will make this acceptance condition fail to actively detect changes of its acceptance sets.
      Returns:
      a map from an ID to the acceptance set of the ID

    • setAt

      public void setAt​(GraphicComponentSet as, int id)
      Sets the acceptance set of a specified ID.
      Parameters:
      as - an acceptance set
      id - the ID of the acceptance set

    • addAt

      public void addAt​(GraphicComponent s, int id)
      Adds a state to the acceptance set of a specified ID. If there is no such acceptance set, an empty one will be created before the addition.
      Parameters:
      s - a state to be added
      id - the ID of an acceptance set

    • addAt

      public void addAt​(GraphicComponentSet cs, int id)
      Adds a set of components to the acceptance set of a specified ID. If there is no such acceptance set, an empty one will be created before the addition.
      Parameters:
      cs - a set of components to be added
      id - the ID of an acceptance set

      Returns:
      the acceptance set of the specified ID, or null if there is no such acceptance set

    • containsAt

      public boolean containsAt​(GraphicComponent c, int id)
      Returns true if a specified component is contained in the acceptance set of a specified ID. If there is not acceptance set of such ID, return false.
      Parameters:
      c - a component
      id - the ID of the acceptance set
      Returns:

    • clone

      public HanoiAcc clone​(java.util.Map<State,​State> smap, java.util.Map<Transition,​Transition> tmap)
      Description copied from class: Acc
      Makes a clone of this acceptance condition. The content of the clone will be changed according to the given maps.
      Specified by:
      clone in class Acc<GraphicComponentRun>
      Parameters:
      smap - a map from states of the automaton with this acceptance condition to states of another automaton with the clone of this acceptance condition
      tmap - a map from transitions of the automaton with this acceptance condition to transitions of another automaton with the clone of this acceptance condition
      Returns:
      the clone of this acceptance condition

      protected void setVisible​(GraphicComponent c, boolean b)
      Description copied from class: Acc

      Specified by:

      c - a component

    • getInfOrs

      protected TransitionSet getInfOrs​(BoolExp<AcceptanceAtom> exp)
      Returns the set of components corresponding to a Boolean expression Inf(x0) | Inf(x1) | ... | Inf(xn).
      Parameters:
      exp - a disjunction of acceptance atoms with type AcceptanceType.Infinite
      Returns:
      the set of components corresponding to the Boolean expression

    • getFinAnds

      protected TransitionSet getFinAnds​(BoolExp<AcceptanceAtom> exp)
      Returns the set of components corresponding to a Boolean expression Fin(x0) & Fin(x1) & ... & Fin(xn).
      Parameters:
      exp - a disjunction of acceptance atoms with type AcceptanceType.Finite
      Returns:
      the set of components corresponding to the Boolean expression

    • getPositive

      public static BoolExp<AcceptanceAtom> getPositive​(BoolExp<AcceptanceAtom> e)
      Returns a simplified Boolean expression that is equivalent to the specified expression. The returned Boolean expression is either True, False, or an expression containing no True, False, and Negation.
      Parameters:
      e - a Boolean expression
      Returns:
      a simplified Boolean expression

    • specialize

      public Acc<?> specialize​(AcceptanceCondition ac)
      Converts this acceptance condition to other types.
      Parameters:
      ac - the target type of acceptance condition
      Returns:
      an acceptance condition that is in the specified type and is equivalent to this acceptance condition, or null if the conversion fails

    • generalize

      public static HanoiAcc generalize​(Acc<?> acc) throws UnsupportedException
      Converts an acceptance condition to a Hanoi acceptance condition.
      Parameters:
      acc - an acceptance condition
      Returns:
      the corresponding Hanoi acceptance condition
      Throws:
      UnsupportedException - if the input acceptance condition is not supported
